alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:02PM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Saco affecting Valley and Phillips Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Milk River at Saco. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water starts flooding the Bjornberg Bridge fishing access site on the north side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:46 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 25.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:46 PM MDT Wednesday was 25.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.9 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.7 feet on 03/04/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning by 1100 AM MDT.
